pages.text:
Weddings & Private Events
Host your ceremony with your toes in the sand right before the sun goes down. Following the ceremony your group can walk down the Beach towards the cafe or hop on a quick ride to the Fort for your private reception. The Park officially closes to the public at sunset, at that time the venue becomes exclusive to your party. The newly updated deck with Tiki Roof is the perfect spot for cocktail hour and dancing. Usually your dinner tables will be set up in the sand in the midst of beautiful vegetation under the twinkle lights. However we can flip flop it with dining under the tiki and dancing on the beach. To create the perfect ambiance a fire pit is set up on the main beach area beyond your dinner tables. Imagine…. dancing under a canopy of stars on the beach in Key West surrounded by only your friends and family!
Find everything you need to make your dream wedding come true.
Please contact us for more information regarding availability, package information, and a personalized quote. Appointments are required to tour the sites and the park.
Photo by Janette De Llanos
The Point
Referred to among locals as “The Point”, this spot is located on the west side of the Park where the Atlantic Ocean and the Gulf of Mexico combine. R2 offers fabulous sunset views year round. Located at the entry of the Key West Shipping channel R2 is always an active site with sunset boats sailing by, fishing boats coming and going and an occasional cruise ship passing, it is a breathtaking experience.
LEARN MORE
CONTACT US
Photo by Meandering Media
East Beach
Also referred to as “The East Beach,” R4 is nestled on white sand and tropical vegetation on the east side of the Park. The R4 site is in the midst of Jamaican palms and lush sea grapes, which creates a secluded atmosphere for small or large groups.
LEARN MORE
CONTACT US
Photo by Iris Moore Photography
Beach Reception
No better way to compliment a beach wedding than with a beach reception at Cayo Hueso Cafe. The perfect combination of sand in your toes, lapping waves on the shore, and a light ocean breeze under a canopy of trees.
LEARN MORE
CONTACT US
Photo by Meagan Puett Photography
The Fortress
A Fortress reception offers privacy and all the feels of a unique celebration. The setting will transport you back in time while getting to enjoy the company of your wedding guests under the brick archways, or dancing to the music in the courtyard under a canopy of stars.
LEARN MORE
CONTACT US
CONTACT US TODAY
Come Celebrate in Paradise
If you’re still not completely sure of the details, and you have any further questions please contact us.
Contact Us
Photo by Filda Konec Photography

The Fortress hours
10:00am to 5:00pm Daily
Cayo Hueso Cafe & Beach Rentals
10:00am to 6:00pm Daily
Beach Rentals & Café:
For information about activities, rental equipment, and the Cayo Hueso Café please call 305-295-0037.
* Please listen to the automated menu, allow 30 seconds to hear all options.
Private Parties & Weddings:

For general information about park regulations, administration, becoming a volunteer, etc:
Call the Park Ranger’s office at 305-292-6713 or write to Fort Zachary Taylor State Park, PO Box 6560, Key West, Florida 33041

Visit Us
601 Howard England Way
Key West, Florida
Directions to the Park
Follow US 1 into Key West. Turn right, following signs to downtown Key West via North Roosevelt Blvd.
At Eisenhower Drive, Roosevelt becomes Truman Avenue.
Continue on Truman, 1 block past Duval to Whitehead Street.
Turn Right on Whitehead. 4 blocks to Southard Street.
Turn left on Southard, continue through the entrance to the Truman Annex residential neighborhood.
At the end of Southard turn left, following the signs to the park entrance.
General Information
For more information about wedding site reservations, after hour events and all inclusive packages contact
Kirsten Corpion
.
Park Hours:
Daily from 8:00am to Sunset
Fortress Hours:
Daily from 10:00am to 5:00pm
Guided Tours daily at 11:00am
Café Hours:
Daily from 10:00am to 6:00pm

Daily from 10:00am to 5:45pm
